tutorial.title: Household Chores
tutorial.descriptionContent: Create a useful summary of your household duties entirely with HTML

executableContent.instructions:
In this project, we'll be applying our newfound HTML skills to create a summary of our household chores! We'll see how using different HTML elements together can be helpful to be more organized!.

To begin, let's setup the boilerplate for `index.html`. We'll start by adding a declaration that tells the browser what kind of document we're working with!

1. Add `<!doctype html>`.

Let's continue with the boilerplate setup. We'll use the `html` tag which will act as a container for additional HTML elements.

1. Add the `html` tag.

Now that we have the `html` tag included, we can add other HTML elements inside! Let's add an element to handle our metadata, such as a title. Recall that we will not see the information from the `title` tag in the browser.

1. Add a `head` tag.
2. Add a `title` tag that says `Household Chores`.

Next, we'll begin working within the body of `index.html`. This is where we'll include elements we want to see on the webpage.

1. Add the `body` tag.

Let's work with our first element within the `body` tag. A heading is perfect for starting the chores plan!

1. Add an `h1` tag with the name `My Chores`.

Next, let's include another heading that is smaller than `h1`. This is helpful to define our garden chores!

1. Add an `h2` tag that says `Garden`.

Let's give this section a nice visual break on the webpage!

1. Add an `hr` tag below the `h2` tag. This tag displays a nice horizontal line into the chores document. This can be helpful if we have more than one chore per module.
2. Add a `p` tag that specifies our task `Remove yellow leaves`.
3. Add another `p` tag with the task `Water the flowers`.

files.name: index.html
files.solvedContent:
My Chores

Garden

Remove yellow leaves

Water the flowers

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: `<hr>` is the tag used to create a horizontal line to separate contents.

executableContent.instructions:
Now that the gardening tasks are defined, let's create the `Kitchen` section.

1. Add an `h2` tag with the text `Kitchen`.
2. Next, include another `hr` tag.
3. Add a `p` tag that has the text `Bake Leo's birthday cake` wrapped in `strong` tags.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
My Chores

Garden

Remove yellow leaves

Water the flowers
files.solvedContent:
My Chores

Garden

Remove yellow leaves

Water the flowers

Kitchen

Bake Leo's birthday cake

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: `<hr>` is the tag used to create a horizontal rule to separate contents.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's add some details for this chore because we don't want to ruin Leo's birthday!

1. Add a `p` tag with the text: `Get 5 candles for the cake`.
2. Add a `p` tag that says `Ingredients: flour, milk, sugar, eggs, chocolate`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
My Chores

Garden

Remove yellow leaves

Water the flowers

Kitchen

Bake Leo's birthday cake
files.solvedContent:
My Chores

Garden

Remove yellow leaves

Water the flowers

Kitchen

Bake Leo's birthday cake

Get 5 candles for the cake

Ingredients: flour, milk, sugar, eggs, chocolate

executableContent.instructions:
Lastly, let's include a convenient way to download our chores and not forget them!

1. Add an `h2` tag that says `Download Chores`.
2. Add an `hr` tag.
3. Add a `button` tag that says `Download`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
My Chores

Garden

Remove yellow leaves

Water the flowers

Kitchen

Bake Leo's birthday cake

Get 5 candles for the cake

Ingredients: flour, milk, sugar, eggs, chocolate
files.solvedContent:
My Chores

Garden

Remove yellow leaves

Water the flowers

Kitchen

Bake Leo's birthday cake

Get 5 candles for the cake

Ingredients: flour, milk, sugar, eggs, chocolate

Download Chores

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: `<hr>` is the tag used to create a horizontal rule to separate contents.
